newsitem.title: USA: US Rep. Archer concerned about alternative to CPI.
newsitem.headline: US Rep. Archer concerned about alternative to CPI.

text.p: House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Bill Archer said Thursday that creating an alternate inflation measure for calculating annual increases in federal benefit programs could create controversy.

"I have a concern that if you have CPI (consumer price index) ... and then you have another independent body that comes up with a different number, you're going to create significant controversy," the Texas Republican said.
The top Republican and Democrat on the Senate Finance Committee have proposed a board to create a more accurate measure and produce a cost of living adjustment annually.
